1.name: Fagus sylvatica
1.desc: Boundaries of growth rings and wood rays are visible to the naked eyes

2.name: Juglans regia
2.desc: Growth rings are often visible to the naked eyes

3.name: Castanea sativa
3.desc: Growth rings are quite visible to the naked eyes

4.name: Quercus cerris
4.desc: Wide and quite visible wood rays

5.name: Alnus glutinosa
5.desc: Wide and little visible wood rays. Blurred growth rings

6.name: Fraxinus ornus
6.desc: Growth rings are often visible to the naked eyes

7.name: Picea abies
7.desc: Blurred boundaries of earlywood and latewood

8.name: Pinus sylvestris
8.desc: Resin canals are visible to the naked eyes. Abrupt transition from the earlywood to the latewood

9.name: Ailanthus altissima
9.desc: Large porous in the earlywood and large rays

10.name: Robinia pseudoacacia
10.type: Ring-porous hardwood Visible wood rays to the naked eyes strong presence of growth rings

11.name: Cupressus sempervirens
11.desc: Discontinuous growth rings and unclear limits earlywood and latewood

12.name: Platanus orientalis
12.desc: Wide and visible wood rays and quite visible growth rings
